panels.description: Number of under-replicated partitions (| ISR | < | all replicas |). Alert if value is greater than 0.
panels.title: Under replicated partitions

panels.description: Number of partitions that donâ€™t have an active leader and are hence not writable or readable. Alert if value is greater than 0.
panels.title: Offline Partitions

panels.description: Number of active controllers in the cluster. Alert if the aggregated sum across all brokers in the cluster is anything other than 1 because there should be exactly one controller per cluster.
panels.title: Active controller

panels.description: Number of partitions on this broker. This should be mostly even across all brokers.
panels.title: Partition count / host

targets.query: SELECT percentile("MeanRate", 95) FROM "kafka_network_request_metrics" WHERE ("request" = 'Produce' AND "host" =~ /^$host$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT percentile("MeanRate", 95) FROM "kafka_network_request_metrics" WHERE ("request" = 'FetchConsumer' AND "host" =~ /^$host$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT percentile("MeanRate", 95) FROM "kafka_network_request_metrics" WHERE ("request" = 'FetchFollower' AND "host" =~ /^$host$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.description: Fetch and Produce requests total time
panels.title: Total Fetch and Produce Req / sec
Failed Production and Fetch req / sec

panels.description: Maximum lag in messages between the follower and leader replicas
panels.title: Replication Lag

panels.description: Average fraction of time the request handler threads are idle
panels.title: Request handler Idle %

panels.description: Average fraction of time the network processor threads are idle
panels.title: Network processor avg Idle %

panels.description: Size of the request queue. A congested request queue will not be able to process incoming or outgoing requests
panels.title: Request / Response queue size

panels.description: Total time in ms to serve the specified request
panels.title: Produce/FetchConsumer/FetchFollower Total time

panels.description:
Queue: Time the request waits in the request queue
Local: Time the request is processed at the leader
Remote: Time the request waits for the follower. This is non-zero for produce requests when acks=all
Response queue: Time the request waits in the response queue
Response send: Time to send the response

targets.query: SELECT last("OneMinuteRate") FROM "kafka_network_request_metrics" WHERE ("name" = 'RequestQueueTimeMs' AND "request" = 'Produce') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(linear)
SELECT last("OneMinuteRate") FROM "kafka_network_request_metrics" WHERE ("name" = 'LocalTimeMs' AND "request" = 'Produce') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(linear)
SELECT last("OneMinuteRate") FROM "kafka_network_request_metrics" WHERE ("name" = 'LocalTimeMs' AND "request" = 'Produce') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(linear)
SELECT last("OneMinuteRate") FROM "kafka_network_request_metrics" WHERE ("name" = 'RemoteTimeMs' AND "request" = 'Produce') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(linear)
SELECT last("OneMinuteRate") FROM "kafka_network_request_metrics" WHERE ("name" = 'RemoteTimeMs' AND "request" = 'Produce') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(linear)

panels.title: Kafka Produce Requests processing time

panels.title: Kafka Fetch Follower Requests processing time

panels.description:
IsrShrinksPerSec : If a broker goes down, ISR for some of the partitions will shrink. When that broker is up again, ISR will be expanded once the replicas are fully caught up. Other than that, the expected value for both ISR shrink rate and expansion rate is 0.

IsrExpandsPerSec : When a broker is brought up after a failure, it starts catching up by reading from the leader. Once it is caught up, it gets added back to the ISR.
panels.title: Isr Shrink / Expand per seconds

list.name: host
list.query: show tag values from  kafka_server_fetch with key = jolokia_agent_url
